doc.after: Pennsylvania Important Bird Area (IBA) #48Â , also known as the North Mountain IBA, encompasses 114,978 acres (46,530Â ha), including all 13,047 acres (5,280Â ha) of the state park and Pennsylvania State Game Lands Numbers 13, 57, and 66. The Pennsylvania Audubon Society designated the IBA, which is defined as a globally important habitat for the conservation of bird populations.[2][23] Ricketts Glen State Park is featured in the Audubon Society's Susquehanna River Birding and Wildlife Trail Guide.[98][106]
